thread.title: Electrician nabbed for kidnapping boy

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Electrician nabbed for kidnapping boy
text:
Tribune News Service
Dehradun, October 21
The city police arrested an electrician for abducting a 7-year-old boy here today. Mohammad Rafiq, a resident of Roorkee, abducted the boy to pressure his mother to marry him. The police have registered a case and sent him to jail. SSP Sadanand Datte told mediapersons here that Afsana, wife of Abdul Hasan, a resident of Gandhigram, had filed a complaint at Kotwali police station yesterday stating Rafiq, who was known to her, has kidnapped his son Sharif. Sharif is a student of Class-II at Sadhuram Government School. She said she had received a call from Rafiq to come to Haridwar to marry him, if she wanted to see her son alive. A police team comprising Laxman Chowki police post in-charge Sub-Inspector Rakesh Kumar, and Dhara police post in-charge Sub-Inspector Naresh Rathore was tasked with solving the case. The SSP said a police team kept Rafiq's cellphone on surveillance and traced his location. They arrested him from near Piran Kaliyar. Rafiq is an electrician. Datte said it was revealed during preliminary investigation that Rafiq had befriended Afsana a year ago and wanted to marry her. However, he could not fulfil his wish she was already married and had three children. He said the police were now looking into his past criminal record.
